oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Promise Land: historic marker and church
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Promise Land Rd., N of Reddon Crossing/Will G Rd, Promise, Dickson Co., TN

Color photograph of two white buildings and a historic marker sign entitled "Promise Land"; building on the right is a two story white church with a one-story porch and gable roof; cross over porch entrance; building on the left is a one-story L-shaped white school with gable roof and about seven visible rectangular windows and main entrance on the left.

Freed slaves established Promise Land shortly after the Civil War. It was the first African American community of Dickson County. In time, is encompassed about 1000 acres, including 50 homes, several stores, two churches, and a school. Only the St. John Church and the schoolhouse remain.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; African American schools -- Tennessee
Churches; Historic sites; Historical markers; Schools
